Military: Afghan inside attack kills 4 US troops

An Afghan police officer turned his gun on NATO troops at a checkpoint in southern Afghanistan before dawn, killing four American service members, according to Afghan and international officials. (AP, 10:06 a.m.)

Boston fans still have
it good with owners

It might not always feel like it, but we’re privileged to have the ownership we do in this town for the Patriots, Celtics, Bruins, and even the Red Sox.

Death masks put a face on history

Bob Weeks collects casts of notable people’s lifeless faces. Over the last 10 years, he has amassed 800 of them. And now he wants to share them with the world.

Stepping up on the Appalachian Trail

The residents of Monson, Maine, are famous up and down the trail for opening their homes, their cars, and their wallets to hikers in need.

A growing number of business incubators in the Boston area is helping the latest generation of technology companies take wing.

Health & Wellness

Study: Watching reruns relaxes brain

When subjects had something difficult to do, they were more likely to watch a rerun on television, or watch a favorite movie or pick up a beloved book. Doing so, their energy levels were restored.
